description: What happened to the dinosaurs? Can some human congenital heart defects be explained by
reference to cardiovascular systems of diving turtles? Examining the origin and evolution
of vertebrates, comparing morphology across vertebrate taxa and examining selective
factors leading to modern forms is of value to health science students, graduate studies
in biology, and people who like dinosaurs. Students attend lectures plus one three-hour
laboratory per week. Counts as "comparative organismal biology" core category.
